channel.title: The Daily Pratchett
channel.description: A quote from Sir Terry Pratchett every day.

item.title: 12-Feb-16
item.description:
"It's an interesting fact that fewer than 17 % of Real cats end their lives with the same name they started with. Much family effort goes into selecting one at the start ("She looks like a Winnifred to *me*"), and the as the years roll by it suddenly finds itself being called Meepo or Ratbag."

- Terry Pratchett, The Unadulterated Cat

item.title: 11-Feb-16
item.description:
"Do not meddle in the affairs of wizards, especially simian ones. They are not all that subtle."

- Terry Pratchett, Lords and Ladies

item.title: 10-Feb-16
item.description:
""I'm a cat person, myself," she said, vaguely. A low-level voice said: "Yeah? Yeah? Wash in your own spit, do you?""

It's a dog's life - Terry Pratchett, Moving Pictures

item.title: 09-Feb-16
item.description:
"That statement is either so deep it would take a lifetime to fully comprehend every particle of its meaning, or it is a load of absolute tosh. Which is it, I wonder?"

- Terry Pratchett, Hogfather

item.title: 08-Feb-16
item.description:
"I thought it was going to be bucket-of-water time myself."

Gaspode's way of saying "I'm sorry, was I intruding?" - Terry Pratchett, Moving Pictures
